definitions.definition: the amount of money that you pay to use something for a particular period of time

examples.text: The phone bill gives a breakdown of the cost of the line rental and of calls.
the broadband package includes 6 months free line rental
The weekly rental on the car was over £200.

definitions.definition: the act of renting something or an arrangement to rent something

examples.text: the world’s largest car rental company
a minimum rental period of three months
a coupon for a free movie rental
The local rental market is booming.

definitions.definition: a house, car or piece of equipment that you can rent

examples.text: ‘Is this your own car?’ ‘No, it's a rental.’

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French, or from Anglo-Latin rentale, from Old French rente, from a root shared by render.
